Description: Company DescriptionSia Partners is a next generation management consulting firm and pioneer of Consulting 4.0. We offer a unique blend of AI and design capabilities, augmenting traditional consulting to deliver exceptional value to our clients. With 2200 consultants in 18 countries and expertise in more than 30 sectors and services, we optimize client projects worldwide. Through our Consulting for Good approach, we strive for next-level impact by developing innovative CSR solutions for our clients, making sustainability a lever for profitable transformation. In 2009 the office in Amsterdam was opened, which is now situated in the Rembrandttoren with a great view from the 28th floor of Amsterdam. We focus on the following sectors: Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Marketing & Customer Experience, Data Science and HR, Transformation & Change. The Dutch team is experiencing strong growth and has now built up an impressive client portfolio, supported by and cooperating with... colleagues from our international offices. Sia Partners Netherlands employs approximately 55 consultants.Job DescriptionSupport the development of the activities of the Global Data Science Business Unit. You will join the Amsterdam Data Science team and implement high-performance software solutions hosted on scalable and secure cloud infrastructures for our Data Science projects as well as our internal Heka solutions.You will be in charge of shaping and executing the future of your expertise within Sia NL. You will work on client projects as well as on building our own Sia AI solutions, together with our NL based data science team and Paris based Heka Engineering team.Your responsibilities include:● Cloud services at GCP, AWS and Azure : choice of architecture, use of storage & compute services, cost monitoring and optimization, role management, Infrastructure as Code● Docker and Kubernetes : containerization & orchestration of applications, management of K8s clusters adapted to Data Science workloads● Programming in python : development of tools executed on the server side (mass data processing, API REST server, authentication, etc.)● CI / CD : management of the integration and continuous deployment of our applications and internal platforms, support for the deployment of Data Science projects with our customers● Infrastructures & Services adapted to Machine Learning : technological watch and implementation of solutions useful to Data Scientists in learning and making their ML models available.QualificationsYou have at least MSc level in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Embedded Systems, Informatica or related field of studyYou have a very good level in Python and have a solid foundation in other languages. You master at least one SQL DBMS (ideally PostgreSQL) and noSQL (ideally MongoDB) and are able to use its advanced features.You are familiar with at least one cloud service platform (GCP, AWS, Azure) with experience mixing different services within the same project.You are comfortable using Docker, automating CI / CD pipelines and have a strong desire to gain skills in Kubernetes if you do not have experience with this solution yet. You are part of the DevOps Culture : support for the code life cycle, from development to deployment and maintenance of applications (a mastery of the Gitlab-CE ecosystem is a plus). You are also familiar with Infrastructure as Code concepts and tools such as Terraform, Ansible or Chef.You are sensitive to security issues and have experience in implementing application protection solutions (certificate management, HTTPS security, OAuth2 authentication, credential management)You are driven by a natural curiosity to actively follow the evolution of the sector with strong convictions on the technologies of the moment. You are proactive and able to quickly gain skills in a new technology, both as a team and independently.You want to get involved and quickly take responsibility for high added value missions within a dynamic structure.You have the ability to work in a team, an open mind, a sense of analysis and you want to join a motivating professional environment where you will share our values of excellence, entrepreneurship, innovation, the culture of sharing, benevolence, personal / professional life balance.What do we offer?Competitive salary with great extra advantages: a company car or flexible mobility plan, a work phone, a clear and structured yearly salary increase and bonuses.Flexible transport options that match your personal needs.Training plan to develop yourself as an expert in your discipline.You have the opportunity to work from home, with the client or from our inspiring office in Amsterdam.Working in an international environment creates opportunities to share knowledge and work together on international projects with colleagues all over the world.Additional InformationFor more information on our Data Science Practice, visit our showroom:https://datascience.sia-partners.com/enSia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs

Your challenge

At ML6, our Machine Learning Engineers work to build state-of-the-art, production-ready and scalable ML applications for clients in a variety of application domains, or work to advise clients in taking their ML tools and processes to the next level. If you consider yourself someone who can not only develop and validate performant models, but also has what it takes to take these models all the way to a deployment to thousands or millions of users, ML6 can provide you with a number of challenging use cases to sink your teeth into.

You will mostly work with Python to solve varied Machine Learning tasks, using various frameworks such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, or Hugging Face and to help put these applications into production on the cloud in order to generate business value for our clients. ML6 delivers projects on all major cloud providers (GCP, AWS, Azure) and is a Premier Google Cloud Service Partner.

With(in) your team you will:
• Efficiently translate customer business... needs into end-to-end technical solutions
• Use Python to deploy production ready pipelines and ML models on Google Cloud/AWS or Azure
• Keep up with and apply state of the art ML research
Why you?

Minimum:
• Work or educational experience in software development
• Work or educational experience with Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence
• Experience with Python
• You have a master’s degree or PhD in computer science or related field
• Being able to work autonomously and take ownership
• Ability to provide expert advice to non-technical staff and clients, excellent verbal and written communication in English (Dutch is a plus).
• Linux

Preferred:
• Version control (Git)
• Contribution to open source projects
• Experience with Google Cloud/AWS or Azure
• Experience with data engineering tasks
Why ML6?
• A fast growing & international environment w we actively work on building a culture that believes in passion for technology, excellence in delivery, doing rather than talking, bringing out the best in others, taking ownership & doing good
• Growth: we are excited to hear about your ideas, passion & interests, and look forward to accelerate your career together
• Knowledge building & sharing: every quarter we organise a chapter conference w we share our knowledge & get inspired. Next to that we participate in tech- events & have a lot of internal knowledge sharing tools.
• We care about our agents: we provide a healthy work environment with a focus on well-being, connectivity, feedback, and open communication
• Ethics & responsibility: we take our responsibility to build secure, reliable and sustainable technology seriously and integrate ethics within our way of working
• An organisation that’s filled with team activities, sports, ping pong & LAN parties, healthy snacks and many more in our vibrant offices
• A competitive salary for your expertise & an optimised benefits program with all these goals in mind. In a nutshell, we've built a place w we truly love working, we think you will too

Job-Title: Senior Software engineer AI & Machine Learning - Remote Netherlands
Description:
We are looking for a talented Senior Software Developer interested in AI and machine learning to join us at Dataiku to work on the very core of our world-renowned platform used by 350+ organizations and thousands of data scientists every day. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will build a cutting-edge product that has a real impact on our customers. You will focus on Dataiku DSS’ machine learning and statistics capabilities, from building algorithms to better use ML models to developing the required visualization interfaces that allow users to make the most of their models.

What we do

Dataiku DSS is an on-premises or SaaS platform that connects together many data science technologies. We work with Pandas, Spark, scikit-learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Kubernetes, and many more. Basically, our technological stack is made up of the latest and greatest technologies from the big data and machine learning landscape.

What you will be doing

Your role will be to add new features or improve... existing ones to help our customers use predictive algorithms and put them into production with an intuitive and user-friendly interface, as well as APIs that let coders control and automate all those operations. You may also develop some other AI features (think NLP, time series, computer vision, labeling management, etc.) or collaborate with the AI Lab, our research department, to develop cutting edge POCs and experiments on a broad set of emerging machine learning topics.

The platform itself is in Java, Python, and Scala for the backend, with JavaScript and Angular on the frontend.

You are the ideal recruit if:
• You have at least 6 years of experience in software engineering.
• You are interested in machine learning and are not afraid of statistics.
• You are customer-oriented — you want to understand how the product is used and solve actual customer problems.
• You know that boosted trees are not only about silviculture.
• You have one or more professional experience building a real product.
• You can mentor less tenured developers, helping them grow both their technical and non-technical skill.
• You are humble and kind.
• You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.

(Note: This is a Software Engineering job. We have separate Data Scientist positions open).

Hiring process:
• Initial call with the talent acquisition manager
• On-site meeting (or video call) with a software developer or a team lead
• Home test to show your skills
• Final interviews with an engineering manager and a VP of engineering
• An informal interview with a Dataiker to understand our culture

Dataiku’s culture is right for you if:
• You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - *flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits *
• You need autonomy to thrive - *we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines *
• You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - *meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more *
• You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week
• You care about giving back - it’s what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing

If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy.* *

Dataiku focuses on Enterprise Software, Analytics, Machine Learning, Big Data, and Artificial Intelligence. Their company has offices in New York City, New York, Denver, Dubai, and Singapore. They have a very large team that's between 1001-5000 employees. To date, Dataiku has raised $837.29M of funding; their latest round was closed on December 2022.

You can view their website at http://www.dataiku.com/ or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

Amsterdam - As a machine learning engineer in our team, you will be serving millions of recommendations per day in video platforms and news platforms. Our mission is to improve the relevance of our digital products to our customers by providing them with the content they want, whenever and wherever they want it.

About us
The Recommendation & Search Area houses all expertise around personalised content recommendations and search within DPG Media. We are a team of Machine Learning Engineers that develop & maintain a collection of APIs that can power all of our News and Video platforms. Our teams are based in Vilvoorde, Belgium and Amsterdam, The Netherlands. We work in an agile philosophy and are open to remote and flexible working regimes.

The entire team is responsible for the operations of our services. This includes actively monitoring different applications and their infrastructure as well as intervening to solve operational problems whenever they arise.

We work with: Python... Scala, Bash, RDB, Kafka, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, PySpark, SciPy, NumPy, Elasticsearch, and Airflow.

What you will be doing
You will work alongside a team of ML Engineers on some of the most innovative ML applications in the region and industry. DPG Media is the local media champion, meaning you will work on some of the most impactful products around. Your main responsibilities:
• Maintain and extend our Recommendation back-end, supporting the entire DPG Media product landscape
• Act like a mentor and lead by example in domains like code quality, efficient design and operational monitoring
• Actively participate and run brainstorms to improve both our back-end and our algorithms
• Design, develop, run and evaluate online A/B-tests
• Support operational excellence through practices like code review and pair programming

We offer
• An experience-based salary.
• 36-hour workweek.
• 12% personal choice budget (of which 8% is holiday allowance).
• Participation in the profit sharing arrangement.
• Personal development opportunities such as education, training and certificates.
• Location in Amsterdam (currently we work hybrid).
• Working with the latest stack.

Even more reasons to work at DPG Media

At DPG Media, we work for more than 90 strong news brands, magazines, television shows, radio stations, and online services such as Qmusic, NU.nl, Tweakers, Libelle, and VTM. Although we look like a media group, we are really a tech company. We get digital transformation done.

We offer a high-performing tech workplace where we treasure freedom, from how you find solutions to choosing your path. Feel free to be an entrepreneur, an apprentice, a team player, and, of course, to be you. We welcome everyone to apply, whatever your background may be. A great bunch of smart colleagues awaits you and are eager for you to join the team, whether that be a project team, a pub quiz team, or a sports team.

Learn what we have to offer you or get to know our tech company! And while you’re at it, you can find us on LinkedIn and Twitter too.

Who you are
• Multiple years of experience developing Machine Learning components at scale in a production environment
• Familiar with basic concepts of statistics and probability theory
• Experience delivering APIs and libraries in Python, Scala or Java
• Experience in Python and key libraries such as pandas, PySpark, SciPy, NumPy
• Experience with Docker / Kubernetes / AWS is a plus

As the largest media company in the Netherlands, we are open to all talents in our society. We call on candidates with a diverse background - in the broadest sense of the word - to apply for this position. It’s the differences between colleagues that lead to surprising insights and innovative solutions. And that, in turn, fits very well with us as an organization. We are curious about you, your qualities, and your experience.

Will you be our new colleague? Then apply now!

Want to know more first? I would be happy to answer your questions via mark.van.dommelen@dpgmedia.nl.

We prefer to do our recruitment ourselves and do not need any help with this

The ideal candidate for this role is based in Amsterdam or London.

We are looking for a Deep Learning Research Engineer to help us improve our training algorithms, data pipeline and model architectures. Together we are building the most advanced AI on tiny embedded hardware.

What you will be doing
• Our deep learning models are truly tiny - the memory footprint of our people detection software is just 1MB. You will train and design even smaller and more accurate models, while also enabling new and more complex ML applications on low-cost and low-power hardware.
• You will improve our data pipeline, model architectures and training software. Sometimes there is relevant literature available, but novel approaches and clever hacks are often required for the problems that we are working on.
• You will work with an extremely talented and driven team that is researching and implementing both new and known methods.
• We encourage you to take initiatives and take on many responsibilities... You will be part of a flat team of ~15 people where everybody has the chance to make a big impact on the direction and success of the company. Career advancement opportunities are to be expected as the company grows.

About Plumerai

Plumerai is making deep learning tiny to enable 100s of billions of intelligent sensors on the edge. Today we are winning customers with our people detection software and ML inference engine software and we will soon be offering many more building blocks that enable our customers to use the most advanced ML inside their products. Making it possible to deploy ML on hardware that is cheap and low-power is the most effective way towards a future where ML helps all of us in the real world.

We build the most accurate and efficient ML solutions by vertically integrating all layers of the stack. From data collection and curation, custom training software and model architectures, to the fastest inference engines, and all the way down to providing the most optimized hardware implementations. If you want to learn more, have a look at some of our talks, our open-source deep learning library Larq and our published research (NeurIPS, MLSys, MLPerf).

Our team is based in London, Amsterdam and Warsaw and we are backed by world-class investors with track records of founding multi-billion dollar deep tech companies.

What You Need
• Strong software engineering skills and proficiency in Python.
• Very comfortable with frameworks such as TensorFlow and Keras (which we use) or PyTorch.
• You are interested in staying up to date with the latest research papers and translating research findings into high-quality code.

Nice To Have
• Experience with training neural networks that moved into production and experience with using custom datasets is highly desirable.
• Experience with object detection and other computer vision tasks.
• Familiarity with efficient deep learning.

We value a proven track record of building things and working with large-scale software projects, either as a professional or through open-source contributions. We look for people that are eager to learn about all parts of the company's success and who can teach themselves new technologies along the way.

What we offer:
• Stock options.
• Competitive salary.
• Relocation assistance.
• Choose your own laptop.
• 25 days of paid vacation time in addition to bank holidays.
• Ability to attend top research conferences like NeurIPS and CVPR.
• We’re still deciding our full benefits package (e.g. parental leave). We’re looking forward to working with our early employees to figure out what matters the most.
• We have flexible working hours and like to work together from our offices on 1-2 fixed days per week, but visiting the office more often is also possible

AI Lead Engineer – NLP/Machine Learning

We live in a world where most information is readily available at our fingertips. You might be surprised to learn that the situation in hospitals is rather different. The systems used for electronic healthcare records (EHR) facilitate the clinical workflow, retrieving and storing information for each patient. There is, however, a large need for secondary usage of this data. Think of linking patients to clinical trials, medical research studies, and care quality assessment. For this purpose, CTcue has developed a search engine that enables medical professionals to find patient cohorts and collect data. In all that we do, we have the doctors and patients at the fore of our mind, and we also make sure to strictly adhere to privacy regulations. CTcue is currently used daily by 30+ hospitals in The Netherlands and in Belgium.

The Role

As our AI Lead Engineer, you will mentor your fellow NLP/ML colleague engineers, define the roadmap together with... colleagues driven by the business requirements as well as being hands-on yourself. In this unique role you shape the AI team and will take on exciting projects in the healthcare domain such as federated learning, NER/NEL, new language models and continuous learning in complex datasets. Using your expertise and problem-solving skills, you can identify potential challenges, convey blockers and implement requirements that are needed to bring our products to the next level.

Requirements
• You have significant experience in AI.
• You have the software engineering skills to implement and integrate AI components in our infrastructure.
• You have knowledge of and a love for NLP tasks such as classification and tagging.
• You understand and can implement a wide range of models/techniques for supervised and unsupervised settings. You have (at least theoretical) experience with deep learning.
• You can describe and speak in an approachable way about complex analyses and concepts within a cross-functional team. You are a great “analytic translator”.
• Good understanding of ML and AI concepts. Hands-on experience in production-grade deployments.
• You have experience in planning in a machine learning context. I.e., in planning when next steps depend on for example experimental outcomes.
• You have experience in guarding the holistic view of a machine learning pipeline within a bigger system. In this case that would be that the pipeline results form an integral part of search in our application, and make things run smoothly with our data warehouse. In this position it would be your responsibility to make sure AI developments are made in such a way that it aids search.
• Experience with planning, defining the roadmap based on business requirements
• Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills
• The ability to read, understand, and explain to others, scientific papers on state-of-the-art machine learning and computer science, as well as the ability to prototype, evaluate and improve the ideas described
• Experience productionizing and maintaining NLP/ML-based automated solutions.
• Excellent English written and verbal communication skills, ability to communicate effectively to both technical and nontechnical audiences.
• Strong experience in Python coding, used both for ML and NLP tasks. Further programming languages are a plus (e.g., R, Go, Rust, Java)

What will you do?
• Enabling and growing the AI team to support an existing product and working on bleeding edge technologies for AI in healthcare.
• Contribute to the codebase as well as leading the team, you will be the primary point of contact for close collaboration with other development teams.
• Internationalisation – Developing our NLP components and prepare them to support a plethora of languages
• Team planning, defining and prioritizing tickets
• Define and setup a ML experiment modelling environment
• Research and apply new NLP / ML methodologies
• Guide the team from inception of concepts to production-ready solutions
• Serve as a mentor and guide junior team members tasks.
• Sink your teeth in exciting novel concepts such as Federated learning

The Team

CTcue is a scale-up, which means there is a lot of room to make your own mark and propose and work out creative solutions. The direction and view are largely determined. There is a clear vision on what we are as a team. The initial versions of the product have passed and now there is an established market for our product. The atmosphere has a start-up feel with great team spirit based on collaboration and chasing a goal together. There is little hierarchy, making everyone in the company approachable.

Those who join us become part of a recognized global leader still willing to challenge the status quo to improve patient care. In this business unit, you will have access to the most cutting-edge technology, the largest data sets, the best analytics tools and, in our opinion, some of the finest minds in the Healthcare industry.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for interview will be contacted.

IQVIA is a strong advocate of diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We believe that a work environment that embraces diversity will give us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and enhance our success. We believe that an inclusive and respectful workplace culture fosters a sense of belonging among our employees, builds a stronger team, and allows individual employees the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code, or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Partner Fraud team is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of Machine Learning Scientists and Engineers. You will have the opportunity to build innovative large scale Machine Learning Models that detect and prevent fraud in real time.

As a Machine Learning Scientist, you’ll have the chance to work on exciting products and play an integral role in bringing them to the next level! You’ll have the chance to collaborate closely with other scientists, engineers, product managers, fraud investigators and various business... stakeholders and take full ownership of your work - from the initial idea generation phase to the implementation of the final product.

You will thrive at Booking.com if you are result-focused, innovative, and with a solid quantitative background, but most of all by understanding our complex business model and the logic behind it.

About Partner Fraud Team

The Partner Fraud area provides solutions for fraud prevention and reducing impact on guests due to fraud while keeping it easy for genuine properties to onboard quickly & smoothly. The team also looks after the prevention and detection of other types of supply side fraud and abuse such as real accommodation partners willingly overcharging guests.

B.RESPONSIBLE

You will primarily develop ML Models, Feature developments in line with organisational objectives and direction. You will be responsible for timely delivery of new features and with a good quality.
• Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into products through machine learning (incl. understanding product requirements, data discovery, model development and evaluation, to implementation of a full production pipeline for both batch and stream-based deployment).
• Use the model’s output to deliver both short-term commercial impact and longer-term differentiated business value and customer experience.
• Define and build proof-of-concepts to test new ideas and demonstrate their potential value to relevant stakeholders.
• Document and share the findings, and identify when these technologies can be generalised into reusable frameworks.
• Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies, and upskilling on these as needed.
• Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues.

B.SKILLED
• At least 3 years of relevant work experience.
• Masters, PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
• Prior experience with Feature Engineering
• Solid understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts.
• Fluency in at least one programming language, with a strong preference for Python.
• Strong working knowledge of Hadoop, Spark and SQL.
• Experience with Tensorflow is a plus
• Experience with putting machine learning models in production.
• Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other stakeholders.

B.Offered
• Living and working in Amsterdam, one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe
• Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travellers worldwide
• Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
• Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
• Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
• Technical, behavioural and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
• Competitive compensation and benefits package and some great added perks of working in the home city of Booking.com

Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

Pre-Employment Screening:

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position

TMC Data Science is looking for a senior Machine Learning Engineer. In this role, you have the opportunity to apply the newest AI/ML techniques to shape and scale to state-of-the-art inventions. As AI and machine learning are relevant to every business in the industry, our team is shaping the future of next-generation AI tools and platforms.
• Build and deliver architecturally and operationally sound, scalable, and resilient ML solutions in the exciting fields of deep learning, natural language processing, image processing etc.
• Shape and prototype innovative approaches on MLOps, driving best-practices including quality, security, responsible and ethical AI/ML, and operational excellence.
• Interact with various stakeholders including data, ML scientists, Sw engineers, architects, etc.
• Help drive our technical culture and thought leadership on MLOps practices
• Ability to distill vague product input into concrete problem definitions.
• Contributes to (AI/MLOps) technology roadmaps... and other strategic related activities.
• Connect to the AI/ML community and academic field to exchange knowledge.
• Inspires his/her team members to get the job done..
| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?
• Experience with using a broad range of Amazon Web Services technologies to develop and maintain secure AWS (Amazon Web Services) based cloud solutions;
• Experience in building large-scale machine-learning infrastructure;
• Experience building CI/CD Pipelines for ML Algorithms, automating the end2end process for ML Pipelines;
• Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Pig, Hive;
• Hands on experience with AI frameworks (Tensor Flow, PyTorch, etc.);
• Experience with container technologies (e.g., Docker and/or Kubernetes);
• Deep knowledge and hands on cloud experience in relation to AI (e.g., AWS Sage Maker, Google Vertex AI Platform, etc.);
• Relevant AI/ML knowledge gained via formal education and/or in combination with industrial experience;
• Strong computer science fundamentals in design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.
| WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?

MC Data Science belongs to enthusiastic group of about 60 professionals in 7 different key competencies of Data Science. From Data Analysts to Machine Learning Engineers, and from juniors to seniors. We share all our knowledge with each other. In the form of Workshops, Quick Scans, Pizza Sessions, Office Days and Q-meetings. We have a strong network, sky-high ambitions and together we'll take care of your career!

We also have our own Cell Council that organizes many activities such as bbq's and game nights.
| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center osition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.

At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in.

We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.

As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.
| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?

We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:
• You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
• You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
• We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
• The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
• The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups

TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Is TMC a perfect fit for you? We’d love to hear from you.

Business Manager Data Science, Netherlands

Tel: +31 (0)6 11 23 63 68
Let your network know what’s going on.

Share:

To make it asuccessful journey,TMC is recruitingmulti-skilled and results-driven expertswho are specialized in collecting, analyzing,interpreting andvisualizingdata.

We are currently looking forData Scientists,Data Architects,Data Analysts, Data Rendering Specialist,Business Analysts, Digital Marketing Experts and many others

Vice President Quantum Machine Learning, Full time, Onsite – Amsterdam, the NetherlandsPASQAL is a major player in the global quantum race. We are a full-stack company and the leading manufacturer of neutral atom quantum computers. Our offerings include quantum computing hardware, cloud access and software solutions for industries related to energy, mobility, healthcare, high tech, aerospace and finance. By embracing the dual analog/digital nature of our quantum computers, we are pushing quantum neutral atom technology forward in the hope of delivering a practical quantum advantage within the next two years.PASQAL is growing their team of talented individuals working on relevant real-world industrial applications of quantum computing, together with our clients and collaborators. The team which focuses on algorithms and applications is based in Amsterdam, a vibrant and livable city with international allure, and an active deep tech community.As Vice President- Quantum Machine Learning... you will work among top scientists and developers in the quantum industry. You will work in partnership with our full-stack quantum team in France developing application software and understanding the reality of quantum hardware.Your tasks: Manage and mentor a team of quantum algorithm developers at various levels in their career (Junior, Mid, & Senior level) The projects you’ll focus on are primarily long-term internal R&D, with additional client and collaborator project work Create vision and roadmap for the subsegment of quantum machine learning algorithm research known as Quantum Neural Networks; this includes primarily regression tasks on multi-dimensional scalar input/output Work with our hardware teams to coordinate the fine-tuning of existing algorithms to our digital-analog approach, incorporating error-mitigation schemes, and develop novel quantum algorithms suitable particularly for neutral atom quantum processors. Work closely together with PASQAL’s use case teams to understand which application domains could potentially benefit from industrially relevant quantum advantage Support your quantum algorithm developers working on client projects, ensure alignment of project directions with research roadmap Support business development efforts by participating in technical presentations and preparatory discussions Help recruit and mentor a team of quantum developers We'll provide training and provide technical experts as you get introduced to the company, algorithm portfolio and hardware specifics. Being a senior level role, having a thorough understanding and experience in general quantum computing and related technology will be required coming in on day 1.This position will report directly to our Senior Vice President R&D: Algorithms & Use cases. The work will be based on site in our Amsterdam office (remote/hybrid option negotiable under exceptional circumstance).RequirementsWhat you will need to be successful in this role coming in: 3+ years of work experience (academic or private sector) in applied research or computer science (applied mathematics, computational physics, computational research, machine learning, etc.) PhD in quantum or a related field (physics, engineering, computer science, applied mathematics etc.) Solid knowledge of the basic principles of quantum physics Solid knowledge of quantum computing and quantum machine learning (QML) Intermediate programming skills (Python preferred) Experience speaking in front of technical and non-technical audiences (ideally in an external customer facing role). Team spirit, ambitious, organized, pro-active, sense of urgency… a true pioneer! Proven professional experience as a leader and mentoring and growing junior team members Professional experience supervising a team of 5-10 junior quantum developers (at the PhD/postdoc level), from the first year English: strong professional communication skills in English is essential (written and oral). Bonus points for: Julia programming experience Software project supervision, development (Project Management) Quantum SDK experience Experience working in a startup environment Building on over 40 years of academic research, co-founded by Alain Aspect one of the 2022 Nobel Laureates in Physics, PASQAL is on track to commercialize a 1000-qubit quantum processor with scalable neutral atom technology and industrially relevant application development in a full-stack setup. This makes PASQAL one of the world-class key players in this quantum race. Will you join us?Fine print: PASQAL is an equal opportunity employer. This is Adyen

Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Facebook, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.

For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. The people of Adyen are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.

Team Lead Machine Learning

Adyen is looking for a Team Lead Machine Learning to join our team in Amsterdam, capable of leading a team sitting at the cornerstone of algorithms, mathematics and engineering, a team that is tasked with solving problems by designing and implementing production-ready data science algorithms and machine... learning models.

We have several teams working with Machine Learning. The main responsibility of each team is to research, design, implement, train, deploy and monitor products based on machine learning, either for batch prediction or real-time, in the areas of:

• Anti-Money Laundering (AML) systems.
• Real-time anomaly detection based on time-series modeling.
• On-line learning algorithms to pick the best optimization decision in a changing environment.
• Clustering algorithms to group customers/shoppers.
• Supervised and semi-supervised learning methods for inference on risk patterns.
• Graph analysis and representation learning for behavior prediction and monitoring.
• NLP for operations automation

As Team Lead Machine Learning you will be responsible for the following:

• Capable of crafting a technical strategy and roadmap for the delivery of machine learning based products, as well as its operationalization in live flows.
• Inspire, lead and energize a mixed group of high-performing engineers, including backend, frontend, machine learning, data science and analysts.
• Lead by example on technical matters and take appropriate decisions at technical level. As such we expect a thorough experience in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Science and Data/ML/Software Engineering.
• Work very closely with a Product Manager in order to ship in time and operationalize successful products.
• Mentor, coach and grow team members, also into leadership positions if the opportunity arises.

Who you are

• You have experience leading technical teams in a high-performance tech environment.
• You see your role as an enabler for others and thus you understand that your job is to make the team deliver.
• You have experience developing, training, validating, benchmarking and monitoring machine learning algorithms in production flows.
• You have experience leveraging a big data framework to create the pipelines needed to feed the models with appropriate data.
• You have a good understanding of Software Engineering practices as well as Data Engineering and MLOps principles.
• You are able to communicate complex outcomes with clarity over a wide range of audiences.
• Product oriented mindset. Experience working with product managers in delivering successful products.
• Technologies: Extensive knowledge of data science and statistics techniques, toolsets and algorithms, such as e.g. Spark, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, XGBoost, Pandas, MLFlow or similar MLOps frameworks, Airflow.
• Mentality: An experimental mindset with a launch fast and iterate mentality. A strong statistics/mathematics background is a plus

Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments

Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you’re from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.

Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!
